summary: The State Department spent about $3.1 billion on pay, benefits, and allowances for employees serving overseas in FY 2023. Most of this spending went to basic compensation, housing, and federal benefits like the employer's contribution toward retirement and health insurance. Cost-of-living allowance—which include reimbursement for dependents' education and extra pay in areas with high living costs—accounted for about 10% of State's spending. The amount State...
title: State Department: Spending on Pay, Benefits, and Allowances for Overseas Employees
